==Japanese==
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{wikipedia|Nattō}}
[[Image:Natto mixed.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|納豆}} (''nattō''): a small bowl of '''[[natto]]''', or '''[[fermented]] [[soybean]]s'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|納|豆}}

===Etymology===
Possibly by extension from {{m|ja|納所|tr=nassho||[[temple]] office for receiving [[donation]]s}}, and originally meaning beans ({{l|ja|豆}}) from or in the {{m|ja|納所}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
* {{ja-pron|なっとう|y=o|acc=3|acc_ref=NHK,DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|なっとう}}

# [[natto]] (a traditional Japanese food product made from fermented soybeans)

====Idioms====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|納豆も豆なら豆腐も豆|なっとう も まめ なら とうふ も まめ}}: "if nattō is also beans, then tōfu is also beans" → a metaphor for how the same starting point can produce different results
{{der-bottom}}

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|納豆烏帽子|なっとう えぼし}}: common alternate word for {{m|ja|折烏帽子|tr=ori eboshi}}, a type of {{m|ja|烏帽子|tr=eboshi||traditional Japanese formal black peaked hat}}
* {{ja-r|納豆菌|なっとう きん}}: ''[[Bacillus subtilis]]'' var. ''natto''
* {{ja-r|納豆汁|なっとう じる}}: a type of [[miso]] [[soup]] made with ground nattō, commonly served in winter
* {{ja-r|納豆売り|なっとう うり}}: a nattō seller
* {{ja-r|納豆肥|なっとうごえ}}: a type of [[fertilizer]] made from [[ferment]]ed and [[compost]]ed soybeans, commonly used to fertilize [[tea]] [[bush]]es
{{der-bottom}}

===See also===
* {{ja-r|ねばねば}}: [[sticky]], [[gooey]] {{qualifier|used to describe the texture of things such as nattō and okra}}
